title: @Meddler Master Yi it seems is still too weak
body:
Are there any plans to help out everyone's favorite melee carry?

In particular, is any consideration being given toward reverting the nerf to Highlander's duration?

replies.body: Not in 6.11. The 6.10 buffs, plus Bloodrazor buffs, have put him much closer to a good spot. We'll be assessing Bloodrazor and a couple of other items again, then making a call on whether to buff some champs like Yi who are still underperforming post mid-season changes. I think it's likely we'll buff him further sometime post 6.11, that's a prediction not a plan though at this point.

I think it's likely we'll buff him further sometime post 6.11, that's a prediction not a plan though at this point.

I would like to point out, outside of winrate considerations, that it's also about the feeling of the champion. Having a short ultimate with a high cooldown makes you feel really clunky and bad. At that point, I would better consider a nerf of Yi's damage if it could go with reverting the ultimate over a buff of his damage and ultimate stays as it is right now.
Even if that means reducing his winrate.

To add onto this, it actually makes his win condition really shitty. In team fights, he needs to use ~2 - 3 seconds to engage, ~1 second lost while in alpha, and he will likely be cc'd/exhausted after that unless your team is so ahead that the enemy team can't afford to hold a cc ability for Yi. That leaves him with less than 3 - 4 seconds to burst a squishy if he's NOT cc'd, and the squishy will likely have some form of mobility that requires you to spend another second or 2 to get back on the target, this can reduce that to 1 - 3 seconds to burst down that squishy. That's a really shitty scenario, so Yi's win condition instead changes to split push, which is not reliable in higher elo where they know how to deal with it, especially since the shorter highlander duration hurts his 1 v 1 duels with tanks tremendously, which means he has to be snowballed too. Snowball + split push is a horrible win condition akin to that of Tryndamere, who is also in a really bad spot.

Not to mention how that change decimated his identity as an assassin that catches people out and hunts them down. His highlander doesn't last long enough for that.

What are your opinions on rageblade? I've noticed that many Yi builds are skipping the item, and I personally feel more successful when I go for builds that avoid it. It seems like this should be a very positive item for Yi, but it's not really doing that job.

In particular, I'm wondering about the purpose of having AP on the item. It doesn't seem like there is any real valuable purpose to it other than keeping the item away from on-hit champions like Yi who should like it but can't take that kind of stat inefficiency. Do you have any insight on why it remains a hybrid item instead of being strictly an on-hit item?

i Really dont think it should, i thought they made yi scale off crit for a reason, this item has AP on it, a stat that yi simply shouldnt scale with

I think forcing him to build AP to make rageblade a sensible item isnt a great idea personally, i think nashors is a much better focused item tbh that does a similar thing, a better idea for a hybrid item would be something that converts AP to AD or vice versa so that building AP or AD wont feel so bad.

I think a better idea for an on hit adc item would be something that causes crits to apply on hits a second time.
